info.title: Sage Accounting API - Chart Of Accounts
info.description: Documentation of the Sage Business Cloud Accounting API.

contact.name: Sage Business Cloud Accounting API Team

tags.name: Coa Accounts
tags.description:
A COA account stores common properties for one or more ledger accounts that belong to a business.

The COA accounts for all the businesses are the same, but a business never uses all existing COA accounts, but
only a subset of them.

COA accounts are grouped in different ways: There is a `ledger_account_type` attribute and an additional
`classification`, the latter not being used on all accounts, but only in some countries like France and
Germany.

For you as a developer, COA accounts are important when creating ledger accounts: You will need to reference
a ledger account, so that the ledger account can be included in the correct column of different reports.

tags.name: Coa Templates
tags.description:
A COA template describes a common set of (ledger) accounts.

Each business in accounting has one COA template assigned to it. Which template is being used
depends on the country where the business is registered, its business type and/or the user's
selection.

tags.name: Ledger Accounts
tags.description:
A Ledger Account keeps ledger entries for a business in Accounting. It has a balance and all ledger accounts
of a business are grouped into different types and in some countries additionally into classifications.

There can be a mandatory or default tax rate assigned to the ledger account, which means that bookings on the
account should (or must) be taxed with that rate.

There are special ledger accounts which cannot be deleted: Control accounts are used in booking rules, for
instance for recording tax liabilities.

tags.name: Ledger Account Classifications
tags.description:
The Ledger Account Classification is a way COA accounts â€” and with that their associated ledger accounts â€” are
grouped. This is not used in all countries where Accounting is available.

tags.name: Ledger Account Types
tags.description:
The Ledger Account Types group COA and their associated Ledger Accounts. Examples are
`CURRENT_LIABILITIES`, `DIRECT_EXPENSES` and `OTHER_INCOME`. This helps building reports and also determining
for which bookings a ledger account can be used.

parameters.name: coa_template_id
parameters.description: Use this to filter by COA Template

parameters.name: updated_or_created_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Coa Accounts changed since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Returns the given number of Coa Accounts per request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to specific page of Coa Accounts

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Coa Accounts (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

### Endpoint Availability

* Accounting Plus: ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª

### Access Control Restrictions

Requires the authenticated user to have any mentioned role in one of the listed areas:
* Area: `Sales`: Full Access, Restricted Access, Read Only
* Area: `Purchases`: Full Access, Restricted Access, Read Only
* Area: `Products & Services`: Full Access, Restricted Access, Read Only
* Area: `Contacts`: Full Access, Restricted Access, Read Only
* Area: `Bank`: Full Access, Restricted Access, Read Only
* Area: `Journals`: Full Access, Restricted Access, Read Only
* Area: `Settings`: Full Access, Read Only

parameters.name: updated_or_created_since
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to Ledger Accounts changed since a given date (format: YYYY-MM-DDT(+|-)hh:mm) or date-time (format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(+|-)hh:mm). Inclusive of the passed timestamp.

parameters.name: visible_in
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to ledger account types visible in a specific area. Valid values are: banking, sales, expenses, other_payments, other_receipts, journals and reporting

parameters.name: not_visible_in
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to ledger account types not visible in a specific area.

parameters.name: show_included_in_chart
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to ledger accounts that are/are not included in the chart

parameters.name: show_control_accounts
parameters.description: Use this to limit the response to ledger accounts that are/are not control accounts

parameters.name: ledger_account_classification_id
parameters.description: Use this to filter by ledger account classification id

parameters.name: show_balance_details
parameters.description: Use this to display the balance details for ledger accounts between a date range (requires from_date and to_date).

parameters.name: exclude_deleted_entries
parameters.description: Exclude deleted ledger entries.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Calculate balances from this date.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Calculate balances to this date.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Use this to filter by the item code or description

parameters.name: sort_order_from_user_setting
parameters.description: Use this to enable ordering ledger accounts according to user settings. Defaulted to 'false'.

parameters.name: filter_inactive_bank_accounts
parameters.description: Use this to filter inactive bank accounts

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Returns the given number of Ledger Accounts per request.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Go to specific page of Ledger Accounts

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Specify the attributes that you want to expose for the Ledger Accounts (expose all attributes with 'all'). These are in addition to the base attributes (name, path)

parameters.name: ledger_account_type_id
parameters.description: Use this to filter by ledger account type id

The system control name for the COA account.

System control names are used in Accounting to identify the correct ledger account for booking taxes
etc.

ledger_account_type.description: The ledger account type for the COA account

ledger_account_classification.description: The ledger account classification for the COA account

tax_rate.description: The default tax rate for the COA account

fixed_tax_rate.description: Indicates whether the default tax rate is fixed or may be changed per transaction

cis_materials.description: Indicates whether the COA account is flagged for CIS Materials

cis_labour.description: Indicates whether the COA account is flagged for CIS Labour

* Accounting Plus: ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

$path.description: The API path for the resource

created_at.description: The datetime when the item was created

updated_at.description: The datetime when the item was last updated

ledger_account_group.description: The ledger account group for the account

name.description:
The name for the ledger account.

Changes to this field do not propagate to other resources, namely not to the name of the associated
bank_account (unlike the behaviour of the UI).

display_name.description: The display name for the ledger account

visible_scopes.description:
The visible scopes for the ledger account.

This indicates in which of the UI's areas the ledger account is displayed and available for user
selection. Possible entries in this array are `bank`, `sales`, `purchasing`, `other_payment`,
`other_receipt`, `reporting`, `journals`, `sales_eu`, `sales_row`, `purchasing_eu`, `purchasing_row`
and `purchasing_hrc`.

included_in_chart.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is included in the chart of accounts

nominal_code.description: The nominal code of the ledger account

ledger_account_type.description: The ledger account type for the ledger account

ledger_account_classification.description: The ledger account classification for the ledger account

tax_rate.description: The default tax rate for the ledger account

fixed_tax_rate.description: Indicates whether the default tax rate is fixed or may be changed per transaction

visible_in_banking.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the banking area of the application

visible_in_expenses.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the purchases area of the application

visible_in_journals.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the journals area of the application

visible_in_other_payments.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other payments area of the application

visible_in_other_receipts.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the other receipts area of the application

visible_in_reporting.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the reporting area of the application

visible_in_sales.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is displayed in the sales area of the application

balance_details.description: The ledger account balance details for the date range provided

is_control_account.description:
Indicates whether the ledger account is a control account.

Control accounts cannot be removed. See also `control_name`.

control_name.description:
The control name for the ledger account.

This is used internally by Accounting to identify the correct ledger account for booking taxes etc.
You cannot add ledger accounts with control name and you cannot modify the control name of existing
ledger accounts.

display_formatted.description: The display name formatted based on coa_list_order in settings

tax_recoverable.description: Indicates that transactions posted to this ledger account have part recoverable taxes (Canada only)

recoverable_percentage.description: The partial recoverable tax rate (Canada only)

cis_materials.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Materials

tax_instalment.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for Tax Intalment (Canada only)

cis_labour.description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Labour

gifi_code.description:
The GIFI code of the ledger account.

GIFI is short for The General Index of Financial Information and it lets the CRA validate tax information electronically instead of manually.
Information from financial statements is categorized under the appropriate 4-digit-long GIFI code and entered on corporate income tax returns.
GIFI is needed when filing a T2 income tax return.

_Canada only_

* Area: `Settings`: Full Access
